channel.title: Initio - Free, multipurpose html5 template by GetTemplate
channel.description: Recent content on Initio - Free, multipurpose html5 template by GetTemplate

item.title: Data Preparation & Analysis
item.description: Transforming raw data via ETL processes followed by uncovering valuable insights and patterns with comprehensive Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for informed decision-making.

item.title: Predicting AirBnB Prices in New York
item.description: Description: I spearheaded a transformative project aimed at predicting Airbnb listing prices in New York City, harnessing regression models and a comprehensive dataset containing over 48,000 listings. This dataset, sourced from Kaggle, encompasses critical details such as location, room type, reviews, availability, and host information. Key Project Phases: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Utilized powerful visualization techniques to understand feature distribution and relationships, guiding feature selection for modeling and visualized correlations among numerical features using Seaborn heatmap.

item.title: Dashboard Development
item.description: Designing and implementing dashboards and reports for stakeholders to monitor business performance in real-time.

item.title: Global Terrorism Trends Visualization Tool
item.description: Description: I spearheaded the development of an advanced data visualization tool centered around the Global Terrorism Database (GTD), meticulously exploring terrorism trends from 1970 to 2017. This interactive platform, carefully tailored with 14 critical variables encompassing dates, locations, tactics, perpetrators, targets, and fatalities, offers an in-depth exploration of global terrorism dynamics. Key Features: Utilized Bokeh and Panel to deliver an immersive and insightful user interface. Focused on a curated dataset, facilitating comprehensive analysis of terrorism’s multifaceted aspects.

item.title: Data Strategy Consulting
item.description: Advising on data collection, storage, and utilization strategies aligned with business objectives and compliance standards.

item.title: Donation Fundraising Marketing Campaign Analysis
item.description: Overview: This project revolves around predicting individual donation likelihood and anticipated donation amounts (in €) for a charity fundraising campaign (“SJ22”). By amalgamating these predictions, the aim is to estimate the expected revenue for each individual. The core strategy involves recommending solicitation to potential donors only if the projected revenue exceeds the solicitation cost (2.00 €), ensuring a positive profit margin. Conversely, if the projected revenue falls short, the recommendation is to avoid solicitation to prevent a net loss.

item.title: Actor Co-occurrence Network Link prediction
item.description: Overview: The project focuses on link prediction within an actor co-occurrence network, where nodes represent actors and edges indicate co-occurrence on the same Wikipedia page. Leveraging both graph structure and node attribute features, the objective is to predict missing or future edges using machine learning models. The dataset consisted a directed graph comprising 10k node pairs, where edges denote co-occurrence on the same Wikipedia page. Methodology: Graph Creation: Populated an empty graph with nodes from node features, establishing actor relationships and facilitating powerful embeddings representing Wikipedia page subjects and environments.

item.title: Hurricane_harvey_UAV-Image-Segmentation
item.description: Objective: The project aimed to develop a semantic image segmentation model leveraging remotely sensed data post-Hurricane Harvey in Houston, Texas. The focus was on accurately identifying common assets in residential areas by segmenting high-resolution photographs captured by a small UAV. The dataset consisted of 299 images with dense segmentation masks containing 27 classes like Property Roof, Swimming Pool, Vehicle, etc. Methodology: Data Augmentation: Enhanced dataset quality using image augmentations: horizontal flip, brightness/contrast/color adjustments, blurring, sharpening, Gaussian noise, and normalization.

item.title: Market Research & Segmentation
item.description: Using data to understand target markets, customer behavior, and segmenting audiences for targeted strategies.

item.title: Methane Detection
item.description: Overview: The challenge at hand involved identifying and localizing methane leaks in the atmosphere using a dataset comprising 64x64 grayscale satellite images from diverse locations. The primary goal was to develop a robust deep learning model capable of accurately discerning whether a specific location exhibits a methane plume or not. This was a team effort along with other contributors including Congjie AN, Vanshika Jain, Oluwafisayomi BADARU, Tunç EREN and Corentin DELLOYE.

item.title: Robotic Process Automation
item.description: Overview: The project focused on leveraging Robotic Process Automation (RPA) methodologies using Selenium and Python in multiple use cases, primarily targeting automation within Gmail and LinkedIn platforms. Use Cases: Automated Gmail Login: Designed and implemented an automated process to log in to Gmail accounts, streamlining the authentication process and eliminating manual intervention. -Bulk Email Sending: Extended the Gmail automation to include the bulk sending of emails. This involved not only the login automation but also the seamless sending of bulk emails, significantly reducing time and effort.

item.title: Transformers and Convolutional Networks for Masked Face Recognition
item.description: In response to the widespread use of face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic, investigating their impact on face recognition systems became crucial. The 2022 research led by Al-Sinan et al. laid the groundwork in this area. Dataset and Pre-trained Models The proposed system was tested on a synthetically masked LFW dataset generated in this study. Moreover, the MAFA and RFMR datasets were used to verify the robustness of the proposed methodology.

item.title: US-Stock-Market-Analysis
item.description: Overview: This study offers an in-depth network analysis of S&P 500 stocks from 2018 to 2022, specifically examining stock connectivity and its evolution during significant events such as the COVID-19 pandemic. The methodology encompasses multi-step procedures involving data collection, detrending, calculation of correlation matrices, and network construction utilizing the Winner-Take-All (WTA) method as detailed in the referenced paper. Leveraging this approach, the project successfully visualizes stock market dynamics, identifying key properties and community structures within the network.

item.title: Predictive Modeling
item.description: Developing models to forecast future trends or outcomes based on historical data patterns.

item.title: Business Process Optimization
item.description: Identifying inefficiencies in workflows and suggesting data-driven improvements for enhanced productivity.
